tweet: .@SenatorWicker and I are united in our belief that the federal government must act on its promise to Mississippi.  https://www.hydesmith.senate.gov/hyde-smith-wicker-introduce-bill-rein-clean-water-act-veto-authority …

We need @EPA to act, but I’ve also introduced a new bill to prohibit the EPA from vetoing congressionally-approved @USACEHQ flood control projects. This bill would immediately nullify the veto preventing pump construction in the Yazoo Backwater. pic.twitter.com/opMX2z7r4m

It is time for the federal government to make good on its promises.  It is time to construct the pumps.  While we work toward that goal, this legislation proposes commonsense reforms to the laws governing the regulation of our nation’s waters and permitting process. pic.twitter.com/HfDg0CAcgi

The people of Mississippi are beyond ready to see this crisis resolved.  They are, frankly, extremely frustrated with the federal government.  More than 17,000 people have signed a petition to remove an EPA 2008 regulatory veto preventing construction of the pumps. pic.twitter.com/Z7OpVZKvy5

Almost 3 months ago, I went to the Senate floor to bring attention the catastrophic flooding happening in the South MS Delta. Today, I'm here again speaking on behalf of thousands of Mississippians still suffering from what has now turned into a 7-month flood w/ no end in sight. pic.twitter.com/RAEVjxQVNe
Shortly I will speak on the Senate floor about the Yazoo Backwater Flood and my latest attempt for a solution. Watch here:  https://www.senate.gov/legislative/floor_activity_pail.htm …

Our domestic seafood industry starts with the fisherman—the harvester or producer, and without them we would be forced to depend on lower quality foreign imports.

Farmers and ranchers who experience serious losses have access to well-established USDA programs to help them survive down years.  Commercial fishermen, including aquaculture operations, do not have that option.

In the wake of a devastating Gulf of Mexico shrimp and oyster season, I have introduced a bill to create a disaster assistance program for commercial fishing and aquaculture operations.  https://www.hydesmith.senate.gov/hyde-smith-proposes-disaster-assistance-program-fisheries-aquaculture … pic.twitter.com/rLHJmPBH9C
